title: Ivartheragnarson
author: Ivartheragnarson
content: Hello all. i have downloaded telegram for my pc and i needed to have two telegram applications in my pc. so i made it . now i  running two telegram account in my pc . but there is a problem. anyone know how to stop telegram auto redirecting?? ( i have named two telegram applications telegram 1 and telegram 2. just think i need to open telegram 2 for joining for a channel through clicking a link. but it opens telegram 1. how to fix this problem as i can choose which telegram i need to use at that time )clicking the link > telegram 1 or telegram 2 i need to choose which telegram i need to use for each time when it  necessary. plz anyone help me to solve this problem . thank you.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: What OS are you trying to do this on and why can't you just switch accounts via the account options pane on the left (mobile)?If it's on desktop, you could also just use telegram for Web or opera to log into the second account.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: I do not use two apps for telegram on the same device, even on mobile that you can use app twin and Android 12 support app twin for telegram, I still prefer to use a single app for my telegram accounts.Use one telegram app for it and add the accounts you want to add to the telegram app. If you want to use the second account to join a channel , click on the second one in a way you can see the messages on it, the second one would be the one that would be used for the channel.If it is the first one that you want to use, change it to the first account to join the channel. This has never been an issue for me both on mobile phone and computer.
